company.name: Refactor Legal
company.tagline: Practical legal services for digital businesses
company.description: Refactor Legal is a law firm run by Jay Gantz, a former software developer, associate at an AmLaw 50 law firm, and in-house counsel at a Fortune 50 company. Jay approaches complicated business deals with a problem-solving mentality and understands how his clients' products work so that he can give practical IP and data/privacy advice.

hero.headline: Bringing a problem-solving and intellectually curious engineering mentality to legal services

about.headline: About Jay Gantz
about.content: Jay Gantz's experiences as a software developer, associate at an AmLaw 100 law firm, and in-house counsel at a Fortune 50 technology company have given him a set of legal skills that are invaluable to digital businesses of all shapes and sizes looking for practical legal services. Jay specializes in negotiating commercial agreements, particularly those relating to building, operating and monetizing websites, mobile apps, other B2B or B2C Web services, and consumer electronics devices. He also provides general counseling in the areas of business and product strategy and development, compliance with industry-specific regulations, data/privacy, and open source software.

values.title: Digital Business Focus
values.description: Specialized in websites, mobile apps, and B2B/B2C services

values.title: Fortune 50 Experience
values.description: In-house counsel experience at major technology company
